244147-000 LOCTITE 532 Thread-Lock Adhesive

PRELIMINARY PROCEDURE
1.
Study all of the assembly drawings and parts lists to become familiar with the layout of the
assembly.
2.
Make up a instrument history folder for each 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER MANDREL.  Record
the instrument ASSET NUMBER.  Obtain a copy of the Final Inspection Check-Out records for
this file.
3.
Verify that all the required parts, tools, and equipment are available.
4.
Secure a clean storage area, work area, and work bench with a vise.
5.
Inspect parts for cleanliness.  Clean all parts of dirt and foreign particles.  Set aside in a
clean storage area.
NOTE
During the assembly process, do not allow dirt or any foreign material particles to
contaminate the parts.  Keep hands, tools, and work area clean.
6.
Inspect all threaded parts for any dings and/or nicks in the threads.  Small dings may be cleaned
up with a thread file if necessary.
7.
At each stage in the assembly, trial fit mating parts, without O-Rings, to insure that all fits are
free of interference and that no conditions exist that would prevent easy assembly.
8.
This completes the preliminary procedures.

SUB-ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES 5
4.1 3.38" OD WTS TOP SUB ASSEMBLY 5
4.2 1668 MA CABLE ASSEMBLY FOR RECEIVER MANDREL 6


3.38" OD WTS TOP SUB ASSEMBLY
1.
Refer to assembly drawing [C-148964-000] and parts list for the 3.38"OD WTS TOP
SUB ASSEMBLY.
2.
One 3.38" OD WTS TOP SUB ASSEMBLY is required per 1668 MA RECEIVER
MANDREL.
NOTE
Before installing any O-ring, lubricate the O-ring and O-ring surfaces with a light
coating of LUBRIPLATE GREASE [P/N 205933-000].
3.
Install two AS-230 O-Rings [09] on the slotted end of the 3.38" TOP SUB [01].  Install two
AS-231 O-Rings [10] on the threaded end of the 3.38" TOP SUB.
4.
Lubricate the 2.5" wide collar groove of the 3.38" TOP SUB with a liberal coat of
LUBRIPLATE GREASE.  Remove the four screws from the SPLIT COLLAR [02] and
separate the two halves.  Install the two halves around the collar groove of the 3.38" TOP
SUB and replace the four screws with LACTATE [P/N 238048-000].
NOTE
Make sure the SPLIT COLLAR is well lubricated and turns freely on the 3.38"
TOP SUB.
5.
Install the SPRING [04] into the threaded end of the 3.38" TOP SUB.  Install
COMPRESSOR SLEEVE [03] into the SPRING.
6.
Install SST RETAINER RING [05] onto COMPRESSOR SLEEVE; and, compress the
SPRING.  Secure the SST RETAINER RING to the 3.38" TOP SUB with three 6-32 FLAT
HEAD SCREWS [06] and LACTATE.
7.
Install the 32-PIN CONNECTOR ASSEMBLY [07] and RETAINER RING [08] into the
slotted end of the 3.38" TOP SUB for temporary storage.
8.
This completes the 3.38" OD WTS TOP SUB ASSEMBLY.

4.3 RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY 8

RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY
1.
Refer to assembly drawing [D-157000-000] and parts list for RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLY.
2.
Eight distinct RECEIVER BODY assemblies are required per 1668 MA RECEIVER
MANDREL.
3.
Inventory and inspect all parts for the eight RECEIVER BODY assemblies.  Secure a clean
working area and verify that all of the required tools are available.
SPECIAL TOOLS REQUIRED
D-156959-001
Retainer Ring Seating Tool
C-156987-001
Diaphragm Body Insertion Tool
C-156987-002
Diaphragm Body Stop Tool
4.
With a permanent marker, number each of the eight RECEIVER BODIES [01] with a "1"
thru "8", on the outer diameter above the TERMINAL #6 location.
NOTE: The following procedures refer to each receiver body.
5.
Install six STANDOFF TERMINALS [12] into the RECEIVER BODY with one drop of
LACTATE [13].  Carefully inspect the TERMINALS before and after installation for damage
to the ceramic insulation.
6.
Install a 5 MEG RESISTOR [14] between the lower levels of TERMINALS #6 and #1.
Install another 5 MEG RESISTOR between the lower levels of TERMINALS #1 and #2.
Note that each RESISTOR should have a strain relief (half loop) on one end and be covered
with a piece of 3/16" SHRINK TUBING [25].  Do not solder at this time.
7.
Install a 1 MEG RESISTOR [15] between the lower levels of TERMINALS #3 and #4.  This
RESISTOR should also have a strain relief (half loop) on one end and be covered with a
piece of 3/16" SHRINK TUBING.  Do not solder at this time.
8.
Install BOTTOM INSULATOR [16] over small end of the RECEIVER BODY.  Seat the
BOTTOM INSULATOR onto the RECEIVER BODY with the wire groove orientated
between TERMINALS #2 and #3.
9.
Install PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL [17] onto the BOTTOM INSULATOR with the red
and black wires channeled thru the wire groove.
10.
Install TOP INSULATOR [18] into the top of PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL.

RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
CAUTION
THE PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTALS ARE FRAGILE.  TORQUE
FIRMLY BY HAND ONLY!
11.
Secure the PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL and INSULATORS in place with the LOCK RING
[19].  Using Hi-Temp LACTATE #262-31 [P/N 245507-000], tighten the LOCK RING
firmly by hand.
NOTE
The PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL must be secured firmly to insure a correct
compressional response.
12.
Lubricate and install two AS-230 O-Rings [09] onto the RECEIVER BODY.
NOTE
Before installing any O-ring, lubricate the O-ring and groove lightly with
LUBRIPLATE GREASE [P/N 205933-000].
13.
Lubricate and install an AS-318 O-Ring [20] into the internal O-ring groove in the large end
of the RECEIVER BODY.
14.
Lubricate and install two AS-136 O-Rings [11] into the internal O-ring grooves in the 2" bore
of the RECEIVER BODY.
15.
Use the special tools to install the DIAPHRAGM BODY [02] into the 2" bore of the
RECEIVER BODY:
a.
Install the DIAPHRAGM BODY STOP TOOL [22] into one end of the 2" bore of the
RECEIVER BODY.
b.
Referring to the exploded view on the assembly drawing, orient the DIAPHRAGM
BODY at approximately 30 E to align a pair of the wire holes with the angular hole in
the RECEIVER BODY (i.e., the angular hole between TERMINALS #1 and #2).
c.
Lubricate and install the DIAPHRAGM BODY into the bore of the RECEIVER BODY
using DIAPHRAGM BODY INSERTION TOOL [21].  The DIAPHRAGM BODY
should slide smoothly but tightly into the bore and seal completely on the two AS-136
O-Rings.

RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
16.
Remove the special tooling.  At this point, the DIAPHRAGM BODY should be installed
symmetrically in the RECEIVER BODY.  Lubricate the internal diameter of the
DIAPHRAGM BODY with one drop of SILICONE OIL [P/N 203208-000].
17.
Install a N5000-137 H SST RETAINER RING [05] into the ring groove of the DIAPHRAGM
BODY.  Orientate the RETAINER RING with the load bearing surface, i.e. the flat side,
facing outward.
18.
Slide a BIMORPH SLEEVE [04] into the DIAPHRAGM BODY with the wire slot facing
towards the center and in line with the wire holes in the DIAPHRAGM BODY.  This
SLEEVE will seat against the RETAINER RING previously installed.
CAUTION
THE  BIMORPH  TRANSDUCERS  ARE  FRAGILE!
19.
Carefully slide a BIMORPH TRANSDUCER [03] into the DIAPHRAGM BODY with the
blue wire facing towards TERMINAL #3 and the red wire facing towards TERMINAL #6.
Do not seat the TRANSDUCER at this time.
NOTE
The orientation of the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER, i.e. with the red wire towards
TERMINAL #6, is critical for the proper polarization of the dipole signal.
20.
Fish the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER wires thru the wire holes in the DIAPHRAGM BODY
and thru the angular hole in the RECEIVER BODY.  The red & blue wires should appear
between TERMINALS #1 and #2.  Leave a complete service loop for each wire in the
bimorph chamber.
21.
Align rubber slots on the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER at approximately 45 E from the wire
holes in the DIAPHRAGM BODY and then seat the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER against the
BIMORPH SLEEVE.
NOTE
The rubber slots on the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER should not line up with the
wire holes of the DIAPHRAGM BODY or the wire slots in the BIMORPH
SLEEVES.  This alignment would reduce the dipole sensitivity of the BIMORPH
TRANSDUCER.

RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
22.
Install another BIMORPH SLEEVE into the DIAPHRAGM BODY with the wire slot facing
towards the center.  Careful align the wire slot in the BIMORPH SLEEVE to the wire holes
in the DIAPHRAGM BODY.  Slide the wire slot over the exposed wire and seat the
SLEEVE against the TRANSDUCER.
23.
Install another N5000-137 H SST RETAINER RING into the ring groove of the
DIAPHRAGM BODY with the load bearing surface facing outward.  Reinstall the
DIAPHRAGM BODY STOP TOOL into other end of the bimorph chamber; and, use the
RETAINER RING SEATING TOOL [23] to compress the rubber and seat the RETAINER
RING.
NOTE
Proper installation of the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER is critical to insure a correct
dipole response.
24.
Before connecting the wires, twist the red & blue wires of the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER
together, 3 to 5 turns per inch to suppress electrical crosstalk.  Check that each wire has a
service loop in the bimorph cavity.  Slide a 2" long piece of 3/16" SHRINK TUBING over
the twisted wires and into the angular hole in the RECEIVER BODY.  Shrink the TUBING.
26.
Secure the twisted red/blue wires and TUBING to TERMINAL #1 with LACING CORD
[10].  Leave a service loop.
27.
Secure the twisted red/black wires from the PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL to TERMINAL
#3 with LACING CORD.  Leave a service loop.
28.
Using HI-TEMPERATURE SOLDER, P/N 203238-000,  solder the RED WIRE from the
BIMORPH TRANSDUCER to the lower level of TERMINAL #2.  Solder the BLUE WIRE
from the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER to the lower level of TERMINAL #6.  Also solder the

RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
31.
Install the other RUBBER DIAPHRAGM onto the other side of DIAPHRAGM BODY.
Install a DIAPHRAGM LID onto the RUBBER DIAPHRAGM.  Using the RETAINER
RING SEATING TOOL, secure the LID by installing another N2000-200 H SST RETAINER
RING with the load bearing side facing outward.
32.
Fish the color coded, twisted pair of wires for the PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL thru the
wire hole between TERMINALS #3 and #4.  Slide a 2" long piece of SHRINK TUBING over
the wires where they pass thru the RECEIVER BODY and shrink into place.  Tie the wires
and TUBING to TERMINAL #4 with LACING CORD.  Refer to the assembly drawing, D-
157000-000, for the RECEIVER WIRING COLOR CODE.
33.
Using HI-TEMPERATURE SOLDER, P/N 203238-000,  solder the BLACK WIRE to the
upper level of TERMINAL #3; and, solder COLORED WIRE to upper level of TERMINAL
#4.  Leave a service loop in the wire between the tie points and the TERMINALS.
34.
Fish the color coded, twisted triplet of wires for the BIMORPH TRANSDUCER thru the
wire hole located between TERMINALS #1 and #6.  Slide a 2" long piece of SHRINK
TUBING over the wires where they pass thru the RECEIVER BODY and shrink into place.
Tie the wires and TUBING to TERMINAL #6 with LACING CORD.
35.
Solder the BLACK WIRE to the upper level of TERMINAL #6; solder the WHITE WIRE to
the upper level of TERMINAL #1; and, solder the COLORED WIRE to the upper level of
TERMINAL #2.  Leave a service loop in the wire between the tie points and the
TERMINALS.
36.
Repeat these steps for all eight RECEIVER BODIES.
37.
Insect the RECEIVER BODIES:
a.
Atlas Manufacturing Department:  Refer to Manufacturing Check-Out Procedures
for the 1668 MA Receiver Mandrel, A-130473-856.
b.
Field Test Procedure:  Refer to Preventive Maintenance Level 3 Procedures for the
1668 MA Receiver Mandrel, A-130473-953.
38.
File a copy of the in-process inspection in the instruments history folder.
39.
This completes the RECEIVER BODY assembly.

RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000], parts list, and wiring diagram [D-156903-100]
for 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
The assembly of the 1668 MA RECEIVER MANDREL may be divided into six distinct sections.
These are:

Receiver Bodies Assembly.





Silicone Fluid Filling
Study the receiver mandrel's assembly drawing and wiring diagram to become familiar with the
layout.  Inspect and inventory all of the required parts and tools.

5.1 RECEIVER BODIES ASSEMBLY 13

RECEIVER BODIES ASSEMBLY
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC
RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
2.
Inspect the eight RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLIES.  Double check the color coding of the
wires, refer to the Wiring Diagram [D-156903-100].  Review the in-process inspection tests.
Inspect the O-rings; and, replace if necessary.
3.
Install 1668 MA CABLE ASSEMBLY [28] thru the downhole end of the LOWER SUB [26].
Leave a 4" service loop inside the LOWER SUB.  The CABLE ASSEMBLY will key and
seat inside the LOWER SUB.  Install a UR-200 SP SST RETAINER RING [38] into the
LOWER SUB to secure the CABLE ASSEMBLY.
NOTE
Before installing any O-ring, lubricate the O-ring and O-ring surfaces with a light
coating of LUBRIPLATE GREASE [P/N 205933-000].
4.
Install one AS-230 O-Ring [18] onto the uphole end of the LOWER SUB [26].
5.
Lubricate the internal diameter of the LOWER SLEEVE [27].  Thread the LOWER
SLEEVE over the wire bundle and onto the LOWER SUB.
6.
Lubricate the copper shielding on the cable bundle with LUBRIPLATE GREASE
[P/N 205933-000].  Secure the top end of the cable together to facilitate fishing.

RECEIVER BODIES ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
NOTE
Proper assembly and orientation of the RECEIVER BODIES is critical for the
correct acoustic response of the 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER MANDREL.
7.
Install the wire bundle thru the #1 RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY [17].  RECEIVER
BODY ASSEMBLY #1 is color coded with the brown wiring.  Pull the entire length of the
cable bundle thru the RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY.  The cable bundle should be routed
around the DIAPHRAGM BODY on the side of TERMINALS #4 and #5.
NOTE
The cable bundle is routed thru the RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY and around
the DIAPHRAGM BODY on the side opposite to the bimorph wires, i.e. between
TERMINALS #4 and #5, so that the delicate bimorph wires are not pulled off the
TRANSDUCER.
Assembly hint: you should remove at least one of the RUBBER DIAPHRAGMS from the
RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY so you can watch the bimorph wiring as you pull the wire
bundle thru the assembly.  An ounce of prevention at this point will save you a pound of
problems later.
8.
Lubricate the downhole O-Ring [20] and internal O-Ring [21] on RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLY with GREASE.  Align TERMINAL #6 on the RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLY to oil fill hole in LOWER SUB; and, gentle seat the first RECEIVER BODY
into the LOWER SLEEVE.
9.
Lubricate and install an AS-106 O-Ring [41] onto an ALIGNMENT SCREW [19]. Install the
ALIGNMENT SCREW into the first RECEIVER BODY, as shown in SECTION C-C.  This
SCREW will key the alignment and position of the RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY.
10.
Lubricate the internal diameter of a PEEK WINDOW [06] and the uphole O-Ring [20] on the
first RECEIVER BODY with GREASE.  Thread the cable bundle and transducer wires thru
the PEEK WINDOW.  Carefully seat the PEEK WINDOW onto the first RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLY.
11.

RECEIVER BODIES ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
12.
Install the wire bundle thru the next RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY [17].  Refer to the table
below for the color coding of the wiring.  Pull the entire length of the cable bundle thru the
RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY.  The cable bundle should be routed around the
DIAPHRAGM BODY on the side of TERMINALS #4 and #5.  The transducer wiring should
be lubricated and routed around other side, i.e. between TERMINALS #1 and #2.
NOTE
The cable bundle is routed on the side opposite to the bimorph wires, i.e. between
TERMINALS #4 and #5.  The transducer wires are routed around the other side,
i.e. between TERMINALS #1 and #2.  Take special care when pulling transducer
wires thru the assembly.
Assembly hint: At least one RUBBER DIAPHRAGM should be removed from the
RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY in order to watch the bimorph wiring as the wire bundle
and transducer wires are pulled thru the assembly.
COLOR CODE OF RECEIVER BODIES' WIRING
1
2
3
4
5
6
7

5.2 PRESSURE COMPENSATION ASSEMBLY 16

PRESSURE COMPENSATION ASSEMBLY
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC
RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
2.
Lubricate and install an AS-230 O-Ring [18] onto the downhole end of the RECEIVER
ADAPTOR [04].  Lubricate and install an AS-318 O-Ring [42] into the downhole end of the
RECEIVER ADAPTOR.
3.
Thread the wire bundle thru the RECEIVER ADAPTOR.
4.
Align the alignment screw hole in the RECEIVER ADAPTOR to the alignment screw hole in
the last RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY.  Gentle seat the RECEIVER ADAPTOR into the
last PEEK WINDOW.
5.
Lubricate and install an AS-106 O-Ring [41] onto an ALIGNMENT SCREW [19]. Install the
ALIGNMENT SCREW into the RECEIVER ADAPTOR, as shown in SECTION C-C.  This
SCREW will key the alignment and position of the RECEIVER ADAPTOR.
6.
Thread the wire bundle thru the FLUID DISPLACER [08].  Insert FLUID DISPLACER into
RECEIVER ADAPTOR.
7.
Install the RUBBER BOOT [07] over the wire bundle and FLUID DISPLACER.  Lubricate
the I.D. of the RUBBER BOOT and the flanged section of the RECEIVER ADAPTOR with
GREASE.  Slide the RUBBER BOOT onto the RECEIVER ADAPTOR.  Align the yellow
line on the RUBBER BOOT with the oil fill hole in LOWER SUB.
8.
Thread the wire bundle thru the 3.62" TOP SUB [11].  Lubricate the I.D. of the RUBBER
BOOT and the flanged section of the TOP SUB with GREASE.  Slide the RUBBER BOOT
onto the TOP SUB.  Align the oil fill hole in TOP SUB with yellow alignment line on the
RUBBER BOOT.  The oil fill holes in the LOWER SUB [26] and the 3.62" TOP SUB should
be aligned at this point.
9.
Using the BAND-IT #C-001 TOOL [P/N-235217-000], band the RUBBER BOOT onto the
RECEIVER ADAPTOR and TOP SUB with 1/4" SST BUCKLES [24] and 1/4"
STRAPPING BAND [25].
CAUTION
THE STRAPPING BAND WILL CUT THE RUBBER BOOT IF INSTALLED
TOO TIGHTLY.
10.
This completes the PRESSURE COMPENSATION ASSEMBLY.

5.3 RECEIVER HOUSING ASSEMBLY 17
5.4 67-PIN BULKHEAD ASSEMBLY 20

RECEIVER HOUSING ASSEMBLY
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC
RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
NOTE
The orientation of the RECEIVER HOUSING [05] may be determined by the oil
fill hole on the downhole end or the timing mark on the uphole end.
2.
Approximately align the oil fill hole in the RECEIVER HOUSING [05] with the oil fill hole
in the LOWER SUB [26].
3.
Slide the uphole end of the RECEIVER HOUSING over the eight RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLIES and the PRESSURE COMPENSATION ASSEMBLY.  The RECEIVER
HOUSING will seat onto the TOP SUB [11].  The timing marks on the TOP SUB and the
RECEIVER HOUSING should be approximately aligned.
CAUTION
DO NOT LIFT THE CONNECTED RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLIES.
EXCESSIVE BENDING LOAD WILL DAMAGE THE PEEK WINDOW [06].
4.
Secure the LOWER SUB in the RECEIVER HOUSING with six ½-13 FLAT HEAD
SCREWS [50], as shown in SECTION B-B.  Install the SCREWS with RTV ADHESIVE
[74] and tighten to 50 ft-lbs torque.  The oil file holes in the RECEIVER HOUSING and
LOWER SUB should be aligned.
NOTE
At this point, the alignment holes in the RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLIES should
be aligned to screw holes in the RECEIVER HOUSING.
5.
Beginning with the first RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY, i.e. the downhole receiver, install
three MODIFIED SET SCREWS [49] into RECEIVER HOUSING, as shown in SECTION
D-D.  Apply RTV ADHESIVE to each SET SCREW.  Install all three SCREWS before
tightening.  Tighten the SCREWS simultaneously to center the RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLY within the RECEIVER HOUSING with consistent .06" radial gap.

6.
Repeat step #6 for the remaining seven RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLIES and the
RECEIVER ADAPTOR [04].  A total of 27 MODIFIED SET SCREWS should be installed.

RECEIVER HOUSING ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
NOTE
Slight movement for the TOP SUB may be required to align the MODIFIED SET
SCREWS in the RECEIVER HOUSING to the RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLIES.
7.
Secure the TOP SUB in the RECEIVER HOUSING with six ½-13 FLAT HEAD SCREWS
[50], as shown in SECTION B-B.  Install the SCREWS with RTV ADHESIVE [74] and
tighten to 50 ft-lbs torque.  The timing marks on the RECEIVER HOUSING and LOWER
SUB should be aligned.
8.
Refer to the wiring diagram [R-156903-100] for the 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER
MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
9.
Using a MULTIMETER [P/N 156331-000], check the insulation and continuity of each of the
thru conductors.  Insulation resistance should be infinite between any two conductors or the
housing.  Conductor continuity should be less than 1 ohm.
10.
Also check the compressional and dipole receivers.  Use a HEWLETT-PACKARD 4194 A
GAIN PHASE ANALYZER if available.
9.
Using OHM METER, ohm out PRESSURE BULKHEAD with wires of RECEIVER CABLE
ASSEMBLY at the top of PRESSURE COMPENSATION ASSEMBLY.
13.
This completes HOUSING ASSEMBLY.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - 5.5 ELECTRONICS AND PRESSURE HOUSING INSTALLATION . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  23
chunk_text:
5.5 ELECTRONICS AND PRESSURE HOUSING INSTALLATION 23

ELECTRONICS AND PRESSURE HOUSING INSTALLATION
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC
RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
2.
Lubricate two AS-231 O-Rings [35].  Also lubricate the gland surfaces and threads on the
3.38" TOPSUB [09] with LUBRIPLATE GREASE [P/N 205933-000].  Install two AS-231
O-Rings over threads and onto TOPSUB.
3.
Carefully insert the ELECTRONICS CHASSIS [03] into the 3.38" TOPSUB [09] and mate
the 67-pin connector on the CHASSIS to the BULKHEAD [10].  Align the flat surface on the
67-pin connector with the alignment key on the BULKHEAD.  You should be able to feel the
orientation of the key.  Push carefully to engage the connector.  When fully engaged, the
flange on the CHASSIS should shoulder against the 3.38" TOPSUB.
4.
Check the alignment holes in the bottom flange of the CHASSIS with the threaded holes in
the TOPSUB.  If necessary, CAREFULLY AND SLOWLY rotate the ELECTRONICS
CHASSIS to correct the alignment.
CAUTION
DO NOT APPLY EXCESSIVE TORQUE TO THE CHASSIS.  THIS COULD
DAMAGE THE PINS OF THE BULKHEAD.  IF THE CHASSIS DOES NOT
ROTATE EASILY,  LOOSEN THE TOPSUB [41] TO FREE THE BULKHEAD.
5.
After correct alignment is obtained, fasten the ELECTRONICS CHASSIS to TOPSUB with
two 5/8"long, 10-32 SST SOCKET HEAD CAP SCREWS [23].
6.
Carefully slide the PRESSURE HOUSING [02] over the ELECTRONICS CHASSIS.
Support the PRESSURE HOUSING so that no bending force is applied to the CHASSIS.
Take care not to pinch the 32-pin pigtail.
Carefully engage the threads of the PRESSURE HOUSING with the TOPSUB.  Makeup the
thread joint by slowly and carefully rotating the PRESSURE HOUSING over the
ELECTRONICS CHASSIS while maintaining straight and true alignment at the threads.
NOTE
Make-up the PRESSURE HOUSING carefully to avoid galling the seal surfaces or
threads.  Holding the HOUSING concentric to the TOPSUB, slowly rotate by hand until
the O-Rings seat.  Use a STRAP WRENCH to tighten the threads to approximately 75 ft-
lbs torque.

5.6 SILICONE FLUID FILLING 25

SILICONE FLUID FILLING
1.
Refer to OIL FILLING PROCEDURES for pressure equalized instruments, [P/N
099194-000].
2.
Using the LAB VACUUM SYSTEM [P/N 078810-000] and two OIL FILLER FITTINGS
[P/N 099605-000], evacuate and fill the 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER MANDREL
ASSEMBLY with 200-100 CS SILICONE OIL [72].
NOTE
The fluid capacity of the 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY is
approximately 3 quarts.
3.
After the MANDREL has been properly filled, re-install the OIL PLUGS [47] with AS-011
O-Rings [48] into the ports on the LOWER [26] and TOP SUBS [11].
4.
This completes the SILICONE FLUID FILLING.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - 6.0 PRESSURE TESTING AND FINAL INSPECTION . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  26
chunk_text:
PRESSURE TESTING AND FINAL INSPECTION
1.
Identification Marking:  Stamp the ASSET NUMBER and the SERIES NUMBER on the
O.D. of the 3.62" TOP SUB [11].
2.
Following the DIPOLE CONFIGURATION MODIFICATION PROCEDURE, Section 7.0,
align the dipole receivers to the desired configuration.
3.
Using a MULTIMETER [P/N 156331-000] and referring the 1668 MA Wiring Diagram [D-
156903-100], check the insulation and continuity of each of the thru conductors.  Insulation
resistance should be infinite between any two conductors or to the housing.  Conductor
continuity should be #1 S.
4.
Test the functional operation of the assembly and perform any addition checks as specified:
a.
Atlas Manufacturing Department: Refer to Manufacturing Check-Out Procedures for
the 1668 MA Receiver Mandrel, A-130473-856.
b.
Field Testing Procedure: Refer to Preventive Maintenance Level 1 Procedures for the
1668 MA Receiver Mandrel.
5.
Pressure and temperature test the 1668 MA RECEIVER MANDREL per the Atlas Pressure
Test Procedure, A-130473-650 .  Retain a copy of the pressure test records and file a copy in
the instrument history folder.
6.
Re-check the insulation and continuity of the thru conductors.
7.
Re-check the functional operation of the assembly.
8.
Check the SILICONE OIL [72] level in the instrument.  A small quantity, 1 ounce, may need
to be added after the pressure test.
9.
File a copy of the final inspection records in the instrument history folder.
10.
This completes the 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER MANDREL.

DIPOLE CONFIGURATION MODIFICATION PROCEDURE
This section outlines the modification procedures to convert the 1668 MA MAC Receiver Mandrel
between the In-Line and 2-Axis dipole configurations.

7.1 MATERIALS REQUIRED 27
#

MATERIALS REQUIRED
Parts Required
Quantity   Description:
156983-000   1 EA
HOUSING, Receiver 8 X4 X4 Configuration
156995-000 27 EA
SCREW, Modified Socket Head Set
259261-106 25 EA
O-RING, AS-106 Natnl B46 70-Durometer
181974-000 12 EA
SCREW, Modified Flat Head ½-13 X .63"long
203208-000
AR
SILICONE OIL, Dow Corning 200-100 CS
223376-000
AR
RTV ADHESIVE, Dow Corning 3145 RTV Sealant
Tools Required:
152194-000 TOOL KIT for WTS Instrument Maintenance
056036-000 1/4-20 T-HANDLE Thread Pulling Tool
150259-000 MODIFIED PLIERS for WTS Retaining Ring
078810-000 VACUUM SYSTEM for Lab
099605-000 FITTINGS for Oil Filling, 2 required
N/A
5/16" HEX SOCKET.
N/A
TORQUE WRENCH

7.2 PRELIMINARY PROCEDURE 27

PRELIMINARY PROCEDURES
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC Receiver
Mandrel Assembly.
2.
Disconnect the 1668 MA Receiver Mandrel from the 1667 EA WTS Acoustic Common and
the 1668 PA Acoustic Isolator.
3.
If Receiver Mandrel has been logged, use a high pressure water or similar manner to
thoroughly clean the entire slotted sleeve section.  Special care must be taken to thoroughly
clean the area around the Receiver Housing [05] and Receiver Bodies [17].
4.
Each successive step in the modification includes cleaning as required and replacement of
any expendable parts such as O-Rings or Screws.

7.3 REMOVING THE RECEIVER HOUSING 28

REMOVING THE RECEIVER HOUSING
1.
Using the Lab Vacuum System [P/N 078810-000] and two Oil Filler Fittings [P/N
099605-000], remove the Silicon Oil [72] from the Receiver Mandrel.
2.
While the Silicon Oil is draining, remove the twenty seven Modified Set Screws [49] and
twenty four Special Set Screws [52], as referenced in Section D-D and Section E-E on the
assembly drawing, respectively.  Replace any or all of the Screws if the hex sockets have
been damaged.
3.
After most of the Silicon Oil has been drained, use the Modified Pliers [P/N 150259-000] to
remove the WTS Retaining Ring [46] from the Lower WTS Sub [30].
4.
Remove Pressure Bulkhead [31] from the Lower WTS Sub with the 1/4-20 T-Handle Tool
[P/N 150210-000].
5.
Unscrew the Lower WTS Sub [30] from the Lower Receiver Sub [26].
6.
Remove six ½-13 Flat Head Screws [50] from Lower Receiver Sub.  Also remove the six
½-13 Flat Head Screws from Top Receiver Sub [11], as referenced in Section B-B.
7.
Placing the Receiver Mandrel on a flat surface or in a trough, carefully slide the Receiver
Housing [5] off of the pressure compensation section and Receiver Body Assemblies [17].
8.
Thoroughly clean the Top and Lower Receiver Subs, the pressure compensation section, and
the eight Receiver Body Assemblies with a suitable solvent.  Take special effort to clean
around the P-Wave Acoustic Windows [06].

7.4 ROTATING THE DIPOLE RECEIVERS 28

ROTATING THE DIPOLE RECEIVERS
This sub-section of the procedure is specific to the conversion from the In-Line dipole configuration
to the 2-Axis dipole configuration.  The conversion from the 2-Axis dipole configuration to the
In-Line dipole configuration is essential the same except in reverse.
NOTE
During the modification, frequently reference the alignment holes in the In-Line and
2-Axis Receiver Housings to insure correct rotation of the Receiver Body Assemblies.

ROTATING THE DIPOLE RECEIVERS (CONTINUED)
1.
Note that the Receiver Body Assemblies [17] are number from the downhole end; thus, the
first Receiver Body Assembly is the lowest assembly and is attached to the Lower Receiver
Sub [26].  Also note the orientation of bulkhead alignment slot in the Lower Receiver Sub.
2.
As referenced in Section C-C on the assembly drawing, remove the Alignment Screw [19]
from first Receiver Body Assembly.
3.
Rotate the Lower Receiver Sub exactly 90 E in the counter-clockwise direction as viewed
from the downhole end.
CAUTION
NEVER ROTATE THE RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLIES MORE THAN 90 E.
4.
Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring [41] on the Alignment Screw.  Lubricate the gland
surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the first Receiver Body Assembly.
5.
Remove the Alignment Screw from second Receiver Body Assembly.  Rotate the first
Receiver Body Assembly exactly 90 E in the clockwise direction as viewed from the downhole
end.  Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring on the Alignment Screw.  Lubricate the gland
surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the second Receiver Body Assembly.
NOTE
With each successive step, the entire assembly below the rotation point is turned.
6.
Remove the Alignment Screw from third Receiver Body Assembly.  Rotate the second
Receiver Body Assembly exactly 90 E in the counter-clockwise direction as viewed from the
downhole end.  Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring on the Alignment Screw.
Lubricate the gland surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the third Receiver Body
Assembly.
7.
Remove the Alignment Screw from forth Receiver Body Assembly.  Rotate the third
Receiver Body Assembly exactly 90 E in the clockwise direction as viewed from the downhole
end.  Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring on the Alignment Screw.  Lubricate the gland
surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the forth Receiver Body Assembly.

ROTATING THE DIPOLE RECEIVERS (CONTINUED)
8.
Remove the Alignment Screw from fifth Receiver Body Assembly.  Rotate the forth Receiver
Body Assembly exactly 90 E in the counter-clockwise direction as viewed from the downhole
end.  Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring on the Alignment Screw.  Lubricate the gland
surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the fifth Receiver Body Assembly.
9.
Remove the Alignment Screw from sixth Receiver Body Assembly.  Rotate the fifth Receiver
Body Assembly exactly 90 E in the clockwise direction as viewed from the downhole end.
Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring on the Alignment Screw.  Lubricate the gland
surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the sixth Receiver Body Assembly.
10.
Remove the Alignment Screw from seventh Receiver Body Assembly.  Rotate the sixth
Receiver Body Assembly exactly 90 E in the counter-clockwise direction as viewed from the
downhole end.  Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring on the Alignment Screw.
Lubricate the gland surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the seventh Receiver
Body Assembly.
11.
Remove the Alignment Screw from eighth Receiver Body Assembly.  Rotate the seventh
Receiver Body Assembly exactly 90 E in the clockwise direction as viewed from the downhole
end.  Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring on the Alignment Screw.  Lubricate the gland
surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the eighth Receiver Body Assembly.
12.
Do not rotate the eighth Receiver Body Assembly.  Remove the Alignment Screw from the
Boot/Receiver Adaptor [04].  Lubricate and replace the AS-106 O-Ring on the Alignment
Screw.  Lubricate the gland surfaces and re-install the Alignment Screw into the
Boot/Receiver Adaptor.

7.5 INSTALLING THE RECEIVER HOUSING 31

INSTALLING THE RECEIVER HOUSING
1.
Carefully slide the Receiver Housing [5] over the Lower Receiver Sub and onto the eight
Receiver Body Assemblies [17] and the pressure compensation section.  Check the alignment
of the dipole receivers and screw holes in the Receiver Housing.
RECEIVER HOUSING
CONFIGURATION
P/N 156968-000
IN-LINE
P/N 156983-000
2-AXIS
2.
Beginning at first Receiver Body Assembly, ie the downhole receiver, install three Modified
Set Screws [49] in the Receiver Housing with RTV Adhesive [74], as referenced in Section
D-D on the assembly drawing.
NOTE
The Modified Set Screws [49] are use to center the Receiver Body Assemblies in
the Receiver Housing.  Install one at a time but do not tighten until all three are in
place.  Tighten the three Screws a half turn each in order to prevent binding and to
center the Receiver Body Assemblies before locking in place.
3.
Repeat step #2 on all of the Receiver Body Assemblies in sequence, 2 thru 8, in a similar
manner.  Replace any or all of the Screws if the hex sockets have been damaged.
4.
Install three Modified Set Screws [49] with RTV Adhesive into the Receiver Housing in a
similar manner to center and secure the Boot/Receiver Adaptor [04].
5.
Install the twenty four Special Set Screws [52] Into the Receiver Housing with RTV
Adhesive, as referenced in Section E-E.  Replace any or all of the Screws if the hex sockets
have been damaged.
6.
Install six ½-13 Flat Head Screws [50] with RTV Adhesive into the Lower Receiver Sub [26]
and Top Receiver Sub [11], as referenced in Section B-B.  Tighten with a torque wrench to
50 ft-lbs torque.  Replace any or all of the Screws if the hex sockets have been damaged.
7.
Replace the two AS-231 O-Rings [35] on the Lower Receiver Sub.  Lubricate the O-Rings
and gland surfaces with Lubriplate Grease [P/N 205933-000] and install.

INSTALLING THE RECEIVER HOUSING (CONTINUED)
8.
Lubricate and install the Lower WTS Sub [30] onto the Lower Receiver Sub.
9.
Replace the two AS-229 O-Rings [35] on the Pressure Bulkhead [31].  Lubricate the O-Rings
and gland surfaces with Grease and install.
10.
Install the Pressure Bulkhead into the Lower WTS Sub using the Bulkhead Installation tool
[P/N 150208-000].
11.
Using the Modified Pliers [P/N 150259-000], install the WTS Retaining Ring [46] from the
Lower WTS Sub.  Take care not to scratch the gland surface inside the Lower WTS SUB.
12.
Refer to OIL FILLING PROCEDURES for Pressure Equalized Instruments [P/N
099194-000].
13.
Using the LAB VACUUM SYSTEM [P/N 078810-000] and two OIL FILLER FITTINGS
[P/N 099605-000], evacuate and fill the 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER MANDREL
ASSEMBLY with 200-100 CS SILICONE OIL [72].
NOTE
The fluid capacity of the 1668 MA MAC RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY is
approximately 3 quarts.
14.
After the MANDREL has been properly filled, re-install the OIL PLUGS [47] with AS-011
O-Rings [48] into the ports on the LOWER [26] and TOP SUBS [11].
15.
Insect the MAC RECEIVER MANDREL:
a.
Atlas Manufacturing Department:  Refer to Manufacturing Check-Out Procedures
for the 1668 MA Receiver Mandrel, A-130473-856.
b.
Field Test Procedure:  Refer to Preventive Maintenance Level 1 Procedures for the
1668 MA Receiver Mandrel, A-130473-951.
This completes the 1668 MA RECEIVER MODIFICATION PROCEDURES.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - 8.0 RECEIVER MANDREL DISASSEMBLY PROCEDURES . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  33 8.1 PRELIMINARY PROCEDURE . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  33
chunk_text:
RECEIVER MANDREL DISASSEMBLY PROCEDURES 8.1 PRELIMINARY PROCEDURE 33

PRELIMINARY INSTRUCTIONS
1.
The REFERENCE DRAWINGS, TOOLS, AND EXPENDABLE MATERIALS
REQUIRED are the same as for assembly.
2.
The disassembly procedures are essentially the same as the assembly procedure except in
reverse.
3.
Preparations of disassembly include washing the unit to remove all mug, grease. dirt, and
other foreign particles if the unit has been run in a well.
4.
Special attention is required to thoroughly clean the RECEIVER HOUSING section of the
RECEIVER MANDREL since excessive foreign material may be trapped.
5.
Each successive step in the disassembly includes cleaning as required to restore all
components to an as-new condition.

8.2 SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS 33

SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC
RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
2.
CAUTION: The BOTTOM BULKHEAD [31] must be remove before the LOWER WTS
SUB [30] may be unscrewed.  Failure to remove the BULKHEAD will result in these parts
galling.
3.
NOTE: Replacement to the 4-40 INSULATED TERMINALS is recommended whenever the
solder joint is broken.
4.
WARNING: Be very careful when removing the Band-It Type STRAPPING BAND [24].
The edges are very sharp and will cut.
5.
NOTE: Use the special 67-PIN BULKHEAD REMOVAL TOOL [P/N 153662-000] to
remove the RETAINING SLEEVE [13] from 67-PIN BULKHEAD [10] and cable assembly.
6.
This completes the 1668 MA MANDREL DISASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG

DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 5
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
5 MEG RESISTORS.
29.
Solder the RED WIRE from the PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL to the lower level of
TERMINAL #4.  Solder the BLACK WIRE from the PIEZOELECTRIC CRYSTAL to the
lower level of TERMINAL #3.  Also solder the 1 MEG RESISTOR.
30.
Lubricate two RUBBER DIAPHRAGMS [06] with GREASE.  Install one DIAPHRAGM
into the 2" bore and onto the DIAPHRAGM BODY.  Install a DIAPHRAGM LID [07] onto
the RUBBER DIAPHRAGM.  Gentle secure the LID by installing a N2000-200 H SST
RETAINER RING [08] with the load bearing side facing outward, i.e. with flat side of the
RETAINER RING showing.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
chunk_text:
6
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG

1668 MA CABLE ASSEMBLY FOR RECEIVER MANDREL
1.
Refer to assembly drawing [C-156998-000], parts list, and wire requirement list [M-
156998-870] for the 1668 MA CABLE ASSEMBLY.
2.
One 1668 MA CABLE ASSEMBLY is required per 1668 MA RECEIVER MANDREL.
3.
Referring to Wire Requirements list [M-156998-870], prepare the following:
Three
114"
22 GA. Single Conductors
Twelve
114"
24 GA. Single Conductors
One
114"
22 GA. Twisted Pair of Conductors
Four
114"
24 GA. Twisted Pair of Conductors
The twisted pairs should have 3 to 5 turns per inch.
4.
Inspect all of the wires for any defects such as cuts, nicks, pinches, flats, or scuffs on the
insulation.
5.
Combine all of the wires into a single bundle and temporarily secure on end with lacing cord.
6.
Strip and crimp one end of all of the wires into the CONNECTOR SOCKETS [P/N 160467-
100] using the CRIMPING TOOL [P/N 093704-000] as per the CRIMPING
SPECIFICATION A-093703-000.  The CONNECTOR SOCKETS are supplied with the 32-
PIN FEMALE CONNECTOR ASSEMBLY [01].
7.
Refer to assembly drawing [C-180009-000] and parts list for the 32-PIN FEMALE
CONNECTOR Assembly.
a.
Install AS-008 O-Ring [03] onto PULL-TOOL INSERT [01] and install into the
FEMALE INSERT MOLDING [07].
b.
Install #10 LOCK WASHER [09] onto PULL-TOOL INSERT.
c.
Screw SST STRAIN RELIEF [157259-000] onto PULL-TOOL INSERT with
LACTATE [10].  This secures the PULL-TOOL INSERT and STRAIN RELIEF to the
FEMALE INSERT MOLDING.
d.
Discard the 10-32 SST HEX NUT [02] that was supplied with the FEMALE INSERT
MOLDING.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
chunk_text:
7
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG

1668 MA CABLE ASSEMBLY FOR RECEIVER MANDREL (CONTINUED)
8.
Insert the crimped CONTACT SOCKETS into FEMALE INSERT MOLDING per wiring
an AS-0015 O-Ring.
9.
Cover each Wire/Socket connection with a .25" long piece of 3/16" SHRINK TUBING [08]
and shrink into place.
10.
At the STRAIN RELIEF [03], wrap Teflon wires with 3 M TAPE [09].  Secure the wires to
the STRAIN RELIEF with LACING CORD [04].
11.
Cover wires with a continuous piece of BELDON SHIELDING [05].  Overlap the STRAIN
RELIEF, 3 M TAPE, and LACING CORD with the SHIELDING.
12.
Cover the downhole end of the BELDON SHIELDING with  a 2.5" long piece of 3/8"
SHRINK TUBING [07].  Fold 1" of the downhole end of the SHIELDING back over the
SHRINK TUBING and cover with a second 2.5" long piece of SHRINK TUBING.  Slide the
SHIELDING and SHRINK TUBING over the STRAIN RELIEF and shrink into place.
13.
Further secure the downhole end of the BELDON SHIELDING and SHRINK TUBING to the
STRAIN RELIEF with a CABLE TIE [10].
14.
Install an AS-0015 O-Ring [13] onto each of the four 4-40 SST FILLISTER HEAD SCREWS
[12].  Cover each SCREW with a 1.5" long piece of 3/16" SHRINK TUBING and shrink into
place.  3/8" of thread will remain exposed.
15.
With LACTATE [11], install the 4-40 SCREWS thru the 32-PIN FEMALE CONNECTOR
ASSEMBLY and into the 32-PIN SST CUP [02].
16.
Final inspection: Check continuity and insulation.
17.
This completes 1668 MA CABLE ASSEMBLY.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
chunk_text:

DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
8
BRN

ORG
YEL
GRN

VIO

13.
Lubricate the downhole O-ring [20] and internal O-Ring [21] on RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLY with GREASE.  Align TERMINAL #6 on the RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLY to oil fill hole in LOWER SUB; and, gentle seat the RECEIVER BODY into
the PEEK WINDOW.
14.
Lubricate and install an AS-106 O-Ring [41] onto an ALIGNMENT SCREW [19]. Install the
ALIGNMENT SCREW into the RECEIVER BODY, as shown in SECTION C-C.  This
SCREW will key the alignment and position of the RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY.
15.
Lubricate the internal diameter of another PEEK WINDOW [06] and the uphole O-ring on
the last RECEIVER BODY ASSEMBLY with GREASE.  Thread the cable bundle and
transducer wires thru the PEEK WINDOW.  Carefully seat the PEEK WINDOW onto the
last RECEIVER BODY.
16.
Repeat steps #12 - #15 for the assembly of third thru eighth RECEIVER BODY
ASSEMBLIES.  Assembly will be the same except for the color of the wiring.
17.
This completes the assembly of the eight RECEIVER BODIES.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
chunk_text:
19
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
5.3.1 Lower WTS Field Joint Assembly
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC
RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
2.
Lubricate two AS-231 O-Rings [35].  Also lubricate the gland surfaces and threads on
the LOWER SUB [26] with LUBRIPLATE GREASE [P/N 205933-000].  Install the
O-Rings onto the threaded end of the LOWER SUB.
3.
Lubricate the internal threads and gland surfaces of the LOWER WTS SUB [30] with
GREASE.  Screw the LOWER WTS SUB onto the LOWER SUB taking care not to
scar the gland surfaces.
4.
Tighten the LOWER WTS SUB with a spanner wrench to at least 75 ft-lbs torque.
Orientation of this LOWER WTS SUB is not critical since the PRESSURE
BULKHEAD [31] is keyed into the LOWER SUB.
5.
Lubricate two AS-229 O-Rings [43] and the gland surfaces on the PRESSURE
BULKHEAD [31] with GREASE; and, install the O-Rings onto the BULKHEAD.
6.
The PRESSURE BULKHEAD will be installed into the LOWER WTS SUB using the
BULKHEAD INSTALLATION TOOL [150208-000].  Note that the correct orientation
of the BULKHEAD is with the short alignment key turned up-hole.
7.
Lubricate the internal diameter of the LOWER WTS SUB with GREASE.
8.
Engage the PRESSURE BULKHEAD with the INSTALLATION TOOL and gently
push the it into the LOWER WTS SUB.  Rotate the BULKHEAD until it keys into the
slot in the LOWER SUB.  Use the threaded collar on the INSTALLATION TOOL to
push the BULKHEAD into its final seated position.  NOTE: The BULKHEAD should
seat against the LOWER SUB and the long key should be aligned with the Oil Fill
Hole.
9.
Install the RETAINER RING [46] in the LOWER WTS SUB using the MODIFIED
PLIERS [150259-000].  Take special care not to scar the gland surface inside the
bore of the LOWER WTS SUB.
10.
Lubricate an AS-230 O-Rings [40] and the gland surfaces on the PIN THREAD
PROTECTOR [45] with LUBRIPLATE GREASE.  Install the O-Rings onto the PIN
THREAD PROTECTOR; and, screw the PROTECTOR into the LOWER WTS SUB.
11.
This completes the LOWER WTS FIELD JOINT ASSEMBLY.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
chunk_text:
20
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG

67-PIN BULKHEAD ASSEMBLY
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC
RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
2.
Cut off the RECEIVER CABLE ASSEMBLY [28] and all of the TWISTED WIRES
approximately 6" above the 3.62" TOP SUB [11].
3.
Strip off approximately 3" of the braided shielding from the RECEIVER CABLE
ASSEMBLY.  Fold over a ½" of braided shielding.  Install two layers of SHRINK TUBING
[51] underneath the end of the braided shielding.  Rap a length of bus wire around the folded
end of the braided shielding.  Insert a 24 GA Black Teflon Wire into the raps of bus wire and
solder in place with HI-TEMP SOLDER [70].  Cover the entire connection with two more
layers of SHRINK TUBING.
4.
Insert the two halves of the FLUID DISPLACER [14] around the RECEIVER CABLE
ASSEMBLY and TWISTED WIRES and into 3.62" TOP SUB [11].
5.
Refer to the assembly drawing [B-150583-000] and parts list for the 67-PIN
RECEPTACLE ASSEMBLY.  Also refer to the receiver mandrel's wiring diagram [D-
156903-100].
6.
Begin the assembly the 67-PIN CONNECTOR by temporarily securing the TWISTED
WIRES to the RECEIVER CABLE ASSEMBLY at approximately the end of the braided
shielding with a piece of LACING CORD.  Untwist and separate all of the wires.
7.
Following the receiver mandrel's Wiring Diagram, feed each wire thru the correct hole in the
RECEPTACLE CAP [2] from the numbered side.  Thermal strip and crimp the wires to the
CONTACT SOCKETS [3] per the CRIMPING SPECIFICATION, A-097403-000.  Align the
large screw hole in the RECEPTACLE BODY [1] and the RECEPTACLE CAP.  Insert all
the CONTACT SOCKETS into the RECEPTACLE BODY; and, close the 67-PIN
CONNECTOR.  Temporarily tape the two halves together with Kapton Tape.
8.
Check the electrical insulation of the 67-PIN CONNECTOR using a Multimeter [P/N
156331-000].  Also check the conductor continuity through to the bottom 32-PIN
CONNECTOR per the Wiring Diagram.  Continuity should be #1 S.
9.
Refer to the assembly drawing [B-150653-000] and parts list for the 67-PIN
CONNECTOR and CABLE CLAMP ASSEMBLY [15].
10.
Connect the STRAIN RELIEF MOUNT [03] onto the downhole end of the BACKSHELL
[02] with three 4-40 SST SOCKET HEAD SCREWS [06] and LACTATE [07].

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
chunk_text:
21
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG

67-PIN BULKHEAD ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
11.
Carefully slide the wiring bundle thru the slot in the BACKSHELL [02].  Align the
BACKSHELL with the mounting screw holes in the 67-PIN CONNECTOR [01].  Attach the
BACKSHELL to the 67-PIN CONNECTOR with one ½" long, 4-40 SOCKET HEAD
SCREW [04] and one drop of LACTATE [07].
NOTE
Take special care not to pinch any wires between the BACKSHELL and the 67-
PIN CONNECTOR.
12.
Completely secure the 67-PIN CONNECTOR with one 3/8" long, 2-56 SST SOCKET
HEAD SCREWS [05] and one ½" long, 2-56 SST SOCKET HEAD SCREW [08] with
LACTATE.
13.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] and parts list for the 1668 MA MAC
RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY.
14.
Adjacent to the STRAIN RELIEF MOUNT, wrap several layers of CHRCO SILICON
TAPE [22] around the wiring bundle.  Cover the SILICON TAPE with a layer of
THERMAL-SET TAPE [33].  Secure the wiring bundle to the STRAIN RELIEF MOUNT
with a HI-TEMP CABLE TIE [32].
15.
Lubricate two AS-138 O-Rings [37].  Also lubricate the gland surfaces and threads on the
TOP SUB [11] with LUBRIPLATE GREASE [P/N 205933-000].  Install the two AS-138 O-
Rings into the smaller O-ring grooves.
16.
Assemble the 67-PIN PRESSURE BULKHEAD [10], referring to the parts list and assembly
drawing, [B-153254-000].  Install the two LOCATING PINS [04] and the ALIGNMENT
KEY [03] with two MODIFIED SCREWS [02] into the PRESSURE CONNECTOR [01] with
LACTATE [05]
17.
Lubricate and install the two AS-135 O-Rings [36] onto the PRESSURE BULKHEAD.
Align the LOCATING PIN on the BULKHEAD to the #4 screw hole in the 67-PIN
CONNECTOR [15] and push them together for full engagement.  The ALIGNMENT KEY
should face away from the CONNECTOR.
NOTE
The ALIGNMENT KEY on the PRESSURE BULKHEAD should be orientated
uphole.
18.
Fit the SPLIT SLEEVE [12] over the 67-PIN CONNECTOR; and, install two AS-138 O-
Rings [37] onto the SPLIT SLEEVE.  Lubricate the O-Rings with GREASE.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
chunk_text:
22
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG

67-PIN BULKHEAD ASSEMBLY (CONTINUED)
19.
Lubricate the internal gland surfaces in the RETAINING SLEEVE [13] with LUBRIPLATE
GREASE.  Also lubricate the O-Rings on the PRESSURE BULKHEAD AND TOP SUB.
Axially align the BULKHEAD, SPLIT SLEEVE, and TOP SUB.  Make sure the wiring is
not pinched.  Press the RETAINING SLEEVE onto the TOP SUB using the 67-PIN
BULKHEAD INSERTION TOOL [P/N 153659-000].
20.
Rotate the BULKHEAD until the orientation of the ALIGNMENT KEY is approximately
perpendicular to the timing mark on the TOP SUB [11], as shown.  Without the O-Rings,
trial fit the 3.38" TOPSUB [09] over the RETAINING SLEEVE and makeup the thread joint.
The timing marks should be aligned.  Note that the BULKHEAD's ALIGNMENT KEY
should be approximately perpendicular to the two 10-32 screw holes in the 3.38" TOPSUB.
Remove the TOPSUB.
21.
Lubricate two AS-231 O-Rings [35].  Also lubricate the gland surfaces and threads on the
TOP SUB [11] with LUBRIPLATE GREASE [P/N 205933-000].  Install the two AS-231 O-
Rings into the larger O-ring grooves.  Lubricate the internal gland surface in the 3.38"
TOPSUB.
22.
Install the 3.38" TOPSUB onto the 3.62" TOP SUB; and, tighten the thread joint to 75 ft-lbs
torque.
23.
Install two AS-011 O-Rings [48] onto two FILLER PLUGS [47].  Lubricate and install the
FILLER PLUGS in the ports in the TOPSUB [11] and in the LOWER SUB [26], for
temporary storage.
24.
Check the electrical characteristics of the 1668 MA RECEIVER MANDREL ASSEMBLY
using a Multimeter, [P/N 156331-000].  Check the insulation and conductor continuity
through the mandrel per the Wiring Diagram, D-156903-100.  Continuity should be #1 S.
NOTE
At this point, the MANDREL ASSEMBLY may be filled with SILICONE OIL [72]
and the polarity and response of the receivers may be tested.
25.
This completes 67-PIN BULKHEAD ASSEMBLY.

topic: Assembly/Disassembly - DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
chunk_text:
23
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 24
DISASSEMBLY/ASSEMBLY PROCEDURES -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
5.5.1
Top WTS Field Joint Assembly
1.
Install PIGTAIL PULLING TOOL [P/N 148154-000] onto the pigtail wiring of the
ELECTRONICS CHASSIS [03].
2.
Lubricate two AS-231 O-Rings [35], the gland surfaces and the threads on the
downhole end of the WTS TOPSUB ASSEMBLY [01] with LUBRIPLATE GREASE
[P/N 205933-000].  Carefully install the two O-Rings.
3.
Using the PIGTAIL PULLING TOOL, guide the pigtail wiring thru the WTS TOPSUB
ASSEMBLY.  Carefully screw the WTS TOPSUB ASSEMBLY into the PRESSURE
HOUSING [02].   Take care not to pinch the pigtail wiring between the CHASSIS
and the WTS TOPSUB ASSEMBLY.
4.
With a 3-5/32" HEX SPANNER WRENCH [P/N 501545-000], tighten WTS TOPSUB
ASSEMBLY to approximately 75 ft-lbs torque.
Note
ALL of the timing marks on the 1668 MA RECEIVER MANDREL
should align to within ±6 E (±0.2 inches).
5.
Remove the PIGTAIL PULLING TOOL from the pigtail wiring.  Plug the 32-PIN
CONNECTOR ASSEMBLY [39] onto the pigtail.  Insert the CONNECTOR
ASSEMBLY into TOPSUB ASSEMBLY.  Secure the CONNECTOR ASSEMBLY
with a UR-200 SP RETAINER RING [29].  Note that the CONNECTOR ASSEMBLY
is supplied with one 70-durometer, AS-031 O-Ring [34].
6.
Lubricate two AS-230 O-Rings [40], the gland surfaces and the spin collar on the
uphole end of the WTS TOPSUB ASSEMBLY with LUBRIPLATE GREASE.  Install
the O-Rings onto the WTS TOPSUB ASSEMBLY.
7.
Lubricate the internal gland surfaces and threads of the BOX THREAD PROTECTOR
[44] and screw it onto the WTS TOPSUB Assembly.
8.
This completes the PRESSURE HOUSING and WTS FIELD JOINT ASSEMBLY.

topic: Test Systems Guide - TEST SYSTEMS GUIDE -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 1.0 INTRODUCTION
chunk_text:
1
TEST SYSTEMS GUIDE -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 
INTRODUCTION
The MAC tool can be checked with or without a trough. Adequate signal strength to
verify the operation can be obtained by using an jumper cable (P/N 148986) and turning
the transmitters to face the receivers.

topic: Test Systems Guide - 2.0 FULL TOOL STRING CHECK-OUT
chunk_text:
FULL TOOL STRING CHECK-OUT
The MAC including the 1667 electronics cartridge and optionally the 3510 WTS repeater
cartridge can be checked using the WTS Test System (P/N 140175)
The required equipment is:
-
A 386 or 486 PC computer with EGA graphic capability, a 80387 Coprocessor and
DOS 3.30 or higher
-
A WTS1 PC Interface Card (P/N 150690)
-
A 5721 Test Panel
-
A 2061 Power Supply
-
Software, ARRAY.EXE, Supplied with Test System and also included in the 1667
Manual
Most of this equipment is included as part of the Test System.
Complete Setup and Operating Instructions for this equipment is included in part in the
1667 Manual and in the Test System Documentation.

P/N 130473-976
NOVEMBER 1994

topic: Test Systems Guide - TEST SYSTEMS GUIDE -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 2.1 TRANSMITTER OR RECEIVER CHECK-OUT
chunk_text:
2
TEST SYSTEMS GUIDE -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 
TRANSMITTER OR RECEIVER CHECK-OUT
The transmitters or receivers and the respective electronics can be completely checked as
individual units using:
-
The Acoustic System Test Box System (P/N 157035)
-
A PC with a serial port
-
Software supplied with the Test Box System
-
A 2061 Power Supply for the Transmitter Tests
The test box allows exercising the transmitters and the receiver multiplexing, gains, and
filters. It can also be used for a board level check of the receiver board. The Instructions
for the use of the test box are included with the Test Box software and in a controlled
procedure, P/N 157035-630, found in the following section.

P/N 130473-976
NOVEMBER 1994

topic: Test Systems Guide - TEST SYSTEMS GUIDE -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 3.0 MAC SYSTEM CHECKOUT PROCEDURE
chunk_text:
3
TEST SYSTEMS GUIDE -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 
MAC SYSTEM CHECKOUT PROCEDURE
1.
The Multipole Array Acoustilog (MAC) may be tested
in the maintenance lab or on the catwalk.
2.
Equipment required:
MAC Tool string
One 32-Conductor WTS Jumper.
DACL Aux. Processor Software.
CLS-K or ECLIPSE Logging System
Four tool stands.
3.
The test setup is shown Figure 1. The tool string should
be assembled on tool stands so sound is not transmitted
through the floor. Use the WTS Jumper to align the
1668 MA
Receiver
Mandrel
with
the
1668 BA
Transmitter Mandrel and 1668 FA Electronics. Use the
CLS-K or Eclipse Logging systems to exercise the tool
string. View the signals on the Aux processor.
4.
The MAC Tool String may also be tested in a water
filled trough. The Receiver and Transmitter nust again
be separated with a 32-con WTS Jumper.
5.
All of the transmitters are strong enough that good
signals will be received even with several feet of
separation. The software delays and system timing may
be checked with travel time calculations. The sound
waves will travel through the air at ≈ 1000 µSec/ft.
6.
Confirm that all four transmitters will fire. The received
signals will reflect the frequency content of the acoustic
transmitters; thus:
Monopole Transmitters ≈ 14,500 Hz,
Dipole Transmitters ≈ 1100 Hz.
7.
Confirm that all sixteen receivers are functioning in a
consistent and repeatable manner.
in the 1668 PA Acoustic Isolator.

P/N 130473-976
NOVEMBER 1994

topic: Level 3 Preventive Maintenance - LEVEL 3 PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE -- 1668MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 1.0 TEST EQUIPMENT . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 3
chunk_text:
1
LEVEL 3 PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
Page 

TEST EQUIPMENT
1.
8020 Fluke Multimeter or equivalent
2.
500 Volt Megger
3.
PC Computer with MS-DOS
4.
Digital Acoustic Test Box System (DATB), P/N 157035-000
a.
Digital Acoustic Test Box, P/N 157110-000
b.
Shearbox Software, P/N 160674-000
c.
Computer Cable, P/N 243728-000
d.
DATB to 1668 MA Receiver Elect Cable, P/N 157033-000
e.
DATB to 32-pin Cannon Conn Cable, P/N 157030-000
f.
3 Conductor, AC power Cable, P/N 082589-000
5.
Function Generator
6.
Oscilloscope with Digital Storage
7.
Operational check with the 1668 tool string
a.
CLS-K or ECLIPS Logging System
b.
3510 XA WTS Common Remote
c.
1667 EA WTS Acoustic A/D
d.
1668 BA Transmitter Mandrel
e.
1668 FA Transmitter Electronics
f.
32-Conductor WTS Jumper

PRELIMINARY PROCEDURES
1.
Refer to the assembly drawing [R-156903-000] for the 1668 MA Receiver Mandrel.
2.
Clean the 1668 MA Receiver Mandrel thoroughly before disassembly.
NOTE
Do not allow mud to build-up and dry anywhere on the mandrel.
3.
Refer to the assembly/disassembly procedures in this manual, section 130473-955, for step
by step instructions.  Refer to the disassembly procedures and special instructions at the end
of this section.
4.
Remove the Receiver Electronics (Item 03, P/N 157025-000) from the Pressure Housing
(Item 02).
5.
Remove and discard all O-Rings.
6.
Using sound judgement, remove and replace any damaged components.
7.
Inspect all mechanical parts for damage, wear, or corrosion.  Closely inspect all O-Rings
gland surfaces and threads.  Replace any parts with damaged or corroded gland surfaces or
threads.
8.
Inspect the 1668 MA MAC Receiver Mandrel for the following:
a.
loose screws
b.
silicon oil level and/or leaks
c.
damage to the peek acoustic window
d.
condition of the rubber boot or bimorph windows
e
general overall quality
9.
Perform the following electrical checks.

topic: Level 3 Preventive Maintenance - 4.1 DIGITAL ACOUSTIC TEST BOX (DATB) SETUP
chunk_text:
DIGITAL ACOUSTIC TEST BOX (DATB) SETUP
1.
Connect Computer Cable, 243728-000, to PC output (P1) of the DATB and to Parallel Port
1, LPT1, of the PC Computer.
2.
Connect DATB to 1668 MA Receiver Elect Cable, 157033-000, to RCVR REF OUT (P2) of
DATB and to bottom of Receiver Electronics that is to be tested.
3.
Connect DATB to 32-pin Cannon Conn Cable, 137030-000, to
TRANSMITTER/RECEIVER output (P3) of the DATB and to the Pigtail connector of the
Receiver Electronics.
4.
Load Shearbox Software in Computer.
5.
Execute test program by typing:
Shearbox<enter>
LEVEL 3 PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE -- 1668 MA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG
6.
The test menu will appear on screen.  Select 2<enter>:
Field Level 3 Maintenance Checkout
7.
Set the DATB TEST MODE switch to the Receiver position.
8.
Connect a Coax Cable from output of Function Generator to the RCVR REF IN (J1) on the
DATB.
9.
Connect a Coax Cable from Oscilloscope input to RCVR OUT (J4) on the DATB.
10.
Plug the DATB into 110 VAC-60 Hz power source.  Turn ON-OFF switch to ON.

topic: Level 3 Preventive Maintenance - 4.2 INPUT SIGNAL SELECTION TEST . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 10
chunk_text:
INPUT SIGNAL SELECTION TEST 10
#

INPUT SIGNAL SELECTION TEST
1.
Select item A from the main menu on PC screen.
2.
Set Function Generator to 1.5 KHz and adjust output to read 2 V p-p signal.
3.
Set the D.A. Test Box Mux Channel selector to the Channel 1 position.  The signal should
be at the output of Receiver Channel 3.
4.
Set the D.A. Test Box Mux Channel selector to the Channel 2 position and Press any key.
The signal should be at the output of Receiver Channel 4.
5.
Set the D.A. Test Box Mux Channel selector to the Channel 3 position and Press any key.
The signal should be at the output of Receiver Channel 1.
6.
Set the D.A. Test Box Mux Channel selector to the Channel 4 position and Press any key.
The signal should be at the output of Receiver Channel 2.
7.
Press any key to return to main menu.
NOTE
Due to some cross wiring and/or erroneous software designations, please note that
#
the Mux Channel selector and the Receiver Channel selector do not directly
correspond.

topic: Level 3 Preventive Maintenance - 4.3 FILTER FREQUENCY CUTOFF CHECKS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 11
chunk_text:
FILTER FREQUENCY CUTOFF CHECKS
1.
Set the D.A. Test Box Mux Channel selector to the Test position.
2.
Set the Receiver Channel switch to channel 1.
a.
Select Item B from the main menu on PC screen.
b.
Set Function Generator to 1.5 KHz and adjust output to read 2 V p-p signal at output of
channel 1.
c.
Lower the frequency of the generator until the output signal reads 1.4 V p-p.  At this
point the frequency should be 500 Hz +/- 25 Hz.  Record frequency on check sheet.
d.
Raise the frequency of the input signal until the signal reaches the 2 V level and then
drops to 1.4 V p-p.  At this point the frequency should be 3kHz +/- 150 Hz.  Record
frequency on check sheet.
e.
Press any key to continue to next setting.
f.
Set Function Generator to 3.0 KHz and adjust output to read 2 V p-p signal at output of
channel 1.
g.
Lower the frequency of the generator until the output signal reads 1.4 V p-p.  At this
point the frequency should be 1000 Hz +/- 50 Hz.  Record frequency on check sheet.
h.
Raise the frequency of the input signal until the signal reaches the 2 V level and then
drops to 1.4 V p-p.  At this point the frequency should be 5kHz +/- 250 Hz.  Record
frequency on check sheet.
i.
Press any key to continue to next setting.
j.
Lower the frequency of the generator until the output signal reads 1.4 V p-p.  At this
point the frequency should  be 1500 Hz +/- 75 Hz.  Record frequency on check sheet.
k.
Raise the frequency of the input signal until the signal reaches the 2 V level and then
drops to 1.4 V p-p.  At this point the frequency should be 23kHz +/- 1150 Hz.  Record
frequency on check sheet.
l.
Press any key to return to main menu.
3.
Repeat steps ‘a.’ through ‘l.’ for Receiver Channels 2, 3 and 4.

ATTENUATION CHECKS
1.
Set the Digital Acoustic Test Box (DATB) Mux Channel selector to the Test position.
2.
Select Item C from the main menu. Set the frequency from Function Generator to 3 KHz and
confirm that the signal on the scope is 2 V pp for each channel by switching to each channel
with RCVR OUT switch on the DATB.
3.
Go through each step of check routine confirming that the signal for each channel is reduced
by 3dB per step.  The pp voltages should be (1) 2 V,  (2) 1.4 V,  (3) 1 V,  (4) 700mV,
(5) 500mV,  (6) 350mV,  (7) 250mV, and  (8) 180mV.
4.
Press any key to return to main menu.

GAIN CHECKS
1.
Set the DATB Mux Channel selector to the Test position.
2.
Select Item D from the main menu on PC screen.
3.
Set frequency to 3kHz and set the signal from function generator to 100mV p-p, as measure
at RCVR REF (J1).
4.
Check signals from channels 1, 2, 3 and 4.  Each channel should read approximately 300mV
p-p.  Verify on check sheet.
5.
Press any key to go to next setting.
6.
Check signals from channels 1, 2, 3 and 4.  Each channel should read approximately 300mV
p-p.  Verify on check sheet.
7.
Press any key to go to next setting.
8.
Check signals from channels 1, 2, 3 and 4.  Each channel should read approximately 4.7 V p-
p.  Verify on check sheet.
9.
Change signal amplitude from function generator input to 20mV p-p, as measure at RCVR
REF (J1).  Press any key to go to last setting.
10.
Check signals from channels 1, 2, 3 and 4.  Each channel should read approximately 14.8 V
p-p.  Verify on check sheet.
11.
Turn OFF the Digital Acoustic Test Box.

topic: Level 3 Preventive Maintenance - 5.0 RECEIVER ELECTRONICS CHECK LIST . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 13 5.1 FILTER FREQUENCY CUTOFF CHECKS . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 13

INSTRUMENT DISASSEMBLY
1.
Refer to the assembly/disassembly procedures in this manual, section 130473-955, for step
by step instructions.  Refer to the disassembly procedures and special instructions in this
section.
2.
Drain and discard the SILICON OIL.
3.
Disassemble the 1668 MA Receiver Mandrel down to the sub-assembly level.  Clean all
components as necessary during the disassembly to return them to an as-new condition.
4.
Remove and discard all O-Rings.
5.
Remove and discard any damaged screws.  Note that the FLAT HEAD SCREWS, Item 50,
used on the MAC Transmitter are special, high strength screws.  Do not replace with
standard, off-the-shelf screws.

PRELIMINARY INSPECTION
1.
Inspect all mechanical parts for damage, wear, or corrosion.  Closely inspect all O-Rings
gland surfaces and threads.  Replace any parts with damaged or corroded gland surfaces or
threads.
2.
Inspect the PRESSURE BULKHEADS, Items 10 & 31, for cracks or chips in the pin
insulation, bent or burnt pins, scared O-Ring glands, and any other damage.  Also check for
electrical leakage.
3.
Inspect the RUBBER BOOT, Item 07, and the rubber Bimorph Windows for any damage
such as cracking or hardening.  Replacement on a regular basis is suggested.
4.
Inspect the peek acoustic WINDOWS for any damage such as cracking.

INSTRUMENT ASSEMBLY
1.
Refer to the assembly/disassembly procedures in this manual, section 130473-955, for step
by step assembly instructions.
2.
Perform the in-process inspection, section 8.0, during the assembly process and before the
installation of the Transformer Channel Assembly, P/N 157061-000.
3.
Replace all O-Rings.
4.
Replace any damaged screws.

topic: Level 3 Preventive Maintenance - 10.0 ACOUSTIC RECEIVER NOTATION . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 18
chunk_text:
ACOUSTIC RECEIVER NOTATION
Receiver numbers shown in table are in decimal notation.  When the
instrument is operating, the receiver numbers shown on the PC screen
are in hexadecimal. Example (Decimal 33 = Hex 21)
If any receiver element reads outside the above range perform the
following tests:  Using Assembly/Disassembly instructions in this
manual, open the window opposite suspect dipole element.
Clean window port thoroughly before removing window.  Disconnect
wires connected to both sides and measure capacity.  If this
measurement does not meet specifications, then replace the element.
(Observe polarity, indicated by wire colors, when connecting new
element.)  If the measured capacity is within tolerance, then check both
wires for continuity and/or shorts to electrical Ground.
If any windows were opened for testing elements, then the mandrel
must be evacuated and refilled with oil.

topic: Circuit Descriptions - CIRCUIT DESCRIPTION - 1668BA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 1.0 INTRODUCTION
chunk_text:
1
CIRCUIT DESCRIPTION - 1668 BA MULTIPOLE ARRAY ACOUSTILOG 
INTRODUCTION
The Transmitter Mandrel contains transformers and transmitting elements for generating omni-
directional acoustic waves (monopole transmitter) and uni-directional acoustic waves (dipole
transmitter). Two transmitters of each type is contained in the assembly.

MONOPOLE TRANSMITTER
The Monopole Transmitter #1 Circuit within the 1668 BA Transmitter Mandrel consists of
œ
Pulse Transformer T1 (32 T/500 T) and Monopole Transmitter #1. (Refer to Figure 945-1.)
Monopole Transmitter #1 consists of two piezoelectric cylinders connected in parallel and a
damping diode.

MONOPOLE TRANSMITTER (CONTINUED)
When the P-Wave FIRE1 circuit is activated, capacitor C1 (on the Transmitter Electronics
Assembly) is discharged through the primary of transformer T1.  The resulting high voltage,
developed across T1's secondary (approximately 4kV peak and 50 microseconds wide) is
applied to the Transmitter Crystals.  An omni-directional pressure wave is generated into the
surrounding fluid medium.
The diode, connected across T1's secondary, functions to damp the monpole transducer's
ringing.
The Monopole Transmitter #2 Circuit operates the same as previously described.

DIPOLE TRANSMITTER
The Dipole Transmitter #3 Circuit within the 1668 BA Transmitter Mandrel consists of Pulse
œ
Transformer T3 (820 T/4920 T), Dipole Transmitter #3, and biasing components R1 and C1.
(Refer to Figure 945-2.)

DIPOLE TRANSMITTER (CONTINUED)
Dipole Transmitter #3 consists of two piezoelectric plates cemented to a conductive substrate
œ
with conductive epoxy.  One plate is cemented with its positive side in contact with the
substrate.  The other plate is cemented with its negative side in contact with the opposite side of
œ
the substrate.  One side of the secondary of T3 is electrically connected to the substrate.  The
œ
other side is connected to the outside of both piezoelectric plates.
œ
When the S-Wave FIRE1 circuit is activated, capacitor C1 (on the Transmitter Electronics
Assembly) is discharged through the primary of transformer T3.  The resulting high voltage,
developed across T3's secondary (approximately 2.4 kV peak and 210 microseconds wide), is
applied across both piezoelectric plates and the center substrate.  Since the piezoelectric plates
œ
are connected with opposite polarities, one plate expands in length and the other contracts.  This
causes the substrate to bend, generating a bi-directional pressure wave into the surrounding fluid
œ
medium.
The piezoelectric plates are polarized and can be depoled by applying a high reverse polarity
voltage.  When Dipole FIRE1 is active, a negative-going, high voltage pulse is developed across
T3's secondary.  The R1-C1 bias circuit functions to prevent the 'plus side' plate from depoling.
A constant high dc voltage (approximately 410 Vdc) is applied to the plate (HV COM), repoling
it during the FIRE Pulse's off time.
The Dipole Transmitter #4 Circuit operates the same as previously described.
